text: North Korea has ramped up its intercontinental ballistic missile testing—seeking to drive a wedge between the U.S. and our allies in the region. We must be clear-eyed about these malign ambitions and reinforce our extended deterrence commitments.

North Korea is increasingly belligerent and malevolent—which is evident in their weapons testing, ongoing threats, and support for Russia's unjust war in Ukraine. We must remain in lockstep with South Korea to maintain stability in Northeast Asia.

Saving the Great Salt Lake requires collaborative action among state, federal, and local governments, as well as partnerships with private enterprises. Sat down with members of the Nature Conservancy of Utah to discuss their work to change the trajectory of the Lake.

Authoritarian states like China and Russia are our greatest security challenge. We must prioritize national security in our financing of development projects in other countries to ensure Xi and Putin don’t gain geopolitical advantage and impede our ability to lead the world.
Senator Feinstein was a trailblazer—a giant of the Senate—who dedicated her life to public service. Ann and I give our condolences to her loved ones, colleagues, and staff as they mourn her passing.

A united front with our allies is key to countering the China threat. Met with U.S. Ambassador to Australia Caroline Kennedy to discuss shared priories between the U.S. and Australia, including making investments in our industrial base to ensure readiness in the Indo-Pacific.

Utah has a significant medical device industry—leading in entrepreneurial care solutions and employing thousands of Utahns with meaningful work. Sat down with the @medicaldevices board for an informative discussion on continuing to support American innovation in healthcare.

Utah's thought leaders and researchers are making significant impacts on our overall society and institutions. Met with the @UUtah's Presidential Societal Impact Scholars to congratulate them and learn about how their research contributes to real-world public engagement.

Year after year, Utah operates with a balanced budget while leading the nation in economic growth and opportunity—and we're fortunate to have Governor Cox at the helm. Enjoyed having @AnnRomney with me for a meeting with @GovCox on advancing our shared priorities for Utah.

As senators, we should demonstrate reverence for the institution in which we serve—and our attire is one of the most basic expressions of that respect. Proud our resolution to reinstate the business attire dress code on the Senate floor passed unanimously.romney.senate.gov/senate-pas…

The bipartisan infrastructure law brought together experts to help us improve strategies to prevent wildfires from becoming catastrophic disasters. Looking forward to working with my colleagues on solutions aligned with the Commission's latest findings. romney.senate.gov/romney-kel…

As our nation faces critical economic challenges, Utah continues to flourish—thanks in major part to our job creators and innovators. Met with the @SaltLakeChamber to thank them for their work and discuss policies that benefit Utah's economy and quality of life.

Regional and community banks are a critical component of Utah's economy—providing financial services for small business and families alike. Sat down with @UtahBankers for a discussion on recent financial trends and policies affecting our state's banking industry.

The CCP can compel its entities to hand over information to promote its military objectives—in turn jeopardizing our national security. Congressional oversight of agreements between the U.S. & China will help ensure we safeguard our IP & maintain our edge.romney.senate.gov/romney-ric…

Updating TRAX cars will not only improve accessibility for riders with disabilities, but ensure light rail service for years to come. @RideUTA Board Chair Carlton Christensen details how funding from the bipartisan infrastructure bill will serve our communities into the future ↓

We must do better to ensure students have the training necessary to pursue good-paying jobs that keep up with Utah's growing economy. Our legislation will equip students to pursue education without the burden of being saddled with debt when they graduate.romney.senate.gov/romney-sin…

Utah's ski and snowboard industry is a significant contributor to our economy—after all, we have the greatest snow on earth! Met with @Snowbird President and General Manager Dave Fields for a discussion on supporting the industry as we enter a new season.

The new Ogden Express electric bus route, which received funding through the bipartisan infrastructure bill, will better connect residents and @WeberStateU students to their city. @RideUTA Trustee Beth Holbrook shares how OGX will be transformational for the Ogden community ↓

Institutions of higher education play an important role in maintaining Utah's economic success, especially as our population grows. Met with @USUPres Elizabeth Cantwell to discuss her plans for how the University can continue supporting the needs of our state for years to come.
Happy birthday, @usairforce! Thankful for our brave airmen who, since 1947, continue to protect our nation and interests with airpower.

Expanding our domestic mining capacity of critical minerals is essential to powering our economy, shoring up our industrial base, and manufacturing green technologies. Enjoyed a discussion on this with leaders from @RioTinto, which operates Utah's @kennecottutah mine.

With two-thirds of Utah held as public land, a fully-funded PILT program helps provide key services to residents of our rural counties. Sat down with Commissioners from Wayne, Piute, Daggett, Duchesne, and Garfield counties to discuss the program's future.

Unforeseen events can threaten water availability in areas along the Wasatch Front. @WeberBasinWater CEO Scott Paxman details how the bipartisan infrastructure bill is supporting a project to improve resiliency and ensure drinking water access for communities in the region ↓
My message to Utahns on my Senate reelection plan:

Rising costs of living have left millions of Americans struggling to make ends meet. Our legislation would raise wages for millions of workers without risking jobs, while also requiring employers to ensure that the wage increase goes to legal workers.romney.senate.gov/romney-cot…

Supply chain shortages continue to pose challenges for businesses in Utah, including those in the new car industry. Met with members of the Utah Automobile Dealers Association to discuss ideas to strengthen automobile supply chains to better serve the needs of Utah's car buyers.

Credit unions play an important role in supporting Utah's small businesses and our state’s continued economic growth. Spent time with leaders from @UtahsCUs for a discussion on supporting their work to provide key financial services to Utahns.

Investments in transportation infrastructure are crucial as Utah continues to grow. @wasatchcouncil Executive Director @GruberAndrew shares how the bipartisan infrastructure bill is providing critical funding for projects that will keep our communities moving for years to come ↓

On the anniversary of 9/11, we come together in solemn remembrance of the thousands of lives lost that day. Let us continue to look to the American flag as a symbol of our resilience and commitment to freedom, as well as the sacrifices made by those who serve our country.

The Biden Administration needs to be honest with the American people and take our public debt seriously. Their newest student loan scheme jeopardizes our economic stability by adding to our already colossal deficit.

The bipartisan infrastructure bill is supporting communities across the Wasatch Front in improving wildfire response capabilities. Mayor Jeff Silvestrini shares how resources from the bill are helping strengthen @MillcreekUT’s fire resiliency along the wildland-urban interface ↓

Utah is rapidly growing, and it's essential that we modernize our public transit to maintain our quality of life. Grateful to have met with @RideUTA officials to see how resources from the bipartisan infrastructure bill are being used to upgrade transit along the Wasatch Front.

America's industrial base should not rely on China and other entities that pose a national security risk. I was grateful to have toured the facility at Utah-based @TealDrones to witness how they're helping secure the United States' domestic supply of drones used for our defense.

To compete with China, we must work with our ASEAN partners to promote freedom and resiliency in the Indo-Pacific. Proud to introduce this legislation with Senator @ChrisVanHollen to bolster economic and cultural engagement with our Southeast Asia friends.romney.senate.gov/romney-van…

The Biden Administration’s new student loan rule would worsen inflation and add to our $32 trillion national debt. Proud to join my colleagues on this resolution to overturn this irresponsible and unfair student loan scheme. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

.@UtahDOT is getting infrastructure projects done on time and on budget. I extended my gratitude to its employees and leadership while touring sites where resources from our bipartisan infrastructure bill are being used to improve roads, highways, and bridges across our state.

As Utah rapidly grows, we must make smart investments that ensure our quality of life for years to come. The bipartisan infrastructure bill is helping us reach that end—providing much needed funding for @RideUTA transit projects that will better connect our communities.

China is our biggest threat over the coming century, and seeing Russia struggle in Ukraine helps squash the CCP's territorial ambitions in Taiwan. Supporting Ukraine doesn't only fulfill our commitment to the Ukrainian people, but supports America's national security interests.

The bipartisan infrastructure bill has provided Utah with the funding needed to repair, replace, and modernize our bridges & highways. Joined @UDOT officials in seeing firsthand how these infrastructure projects are improving the quality of life for communities around our state.

We can't allow the Chinese Communist Party to infiltrate America’s K-12 classrooms—spreading its ideals and propaganda to our children. The Administration must investigate how much funding from hostile adversaries has entered the U.S. education system. romney.senate.gov/romney-sco…

We're miles behind China in mining critical minerals. Of the roughly 35 critical minerals needed for our industrial base and economy, 28 of them can be mined in Utah. The President's monument designations leave us beholden to the CCP—unable to take advantage of our own resources.

It makes no sense for our government to use drones manufactured in countries like China. Utah-based @TealDrones is working to decrease U.S. dependence on China for products critical to our security & exemplifies how free enterprise fosters innovation—an edge we have over the CCP.

Some people come to Washington just to make noise, especially as it relates to federal spending. Reining in our burgeoning spending and tackling our debt must be a top priority, and in order to do this, we must rescue our entitlement programs from impending insolvency.
Majority Leader @SteveScalise is a fighter, and we are all pulling for him as he fights this battle. Ann and I are keeping you in our prayers, Steve.

China is rapidly becoming a global power, and its economy and military is on track to surpass the U.S. We need a comprehensive strategy to address this serious threat to freedom and the global order. Had an engaging discussion with the @SutherlandInst at the @UUtah.

If we allow China to become the global power, the CCP will seek to isolate the U.S. and force the world to play by its rules—which would threaten our freedoms and create a frightening world for future generations. We must take strategic action now to ensure America's strength.

By helping negotiate the bipartisan infrastructure bill, I ensured Utah got its fair share of funding for projects to improve our communities. This funding is helping local communities replace decrepit bridges—like this one in Sandy. Our bill continues to deliver for Utah.

The single most important thing we can do to strengthen America relative to China is to see Russia defeated in Ukraine. A weakened Russia deters the CCP's territorial ambition, and halts Putin's vision of reestablishing the old Soviet Union. Supporting Ukraine is in our interest.

Freedom is our advantage over the CCP—it allows us to continue leading the world in technology and innovation. Joined entrepreneurs and leaders at Provo-based RevRoad for a discussion on securing America’s world leadership and countering China through supporting free enterprise.

.@UtahDOT has received over $526 million in funding from the bipartisan infrastructure bill for improvement projects throughout the state. Toured job sites along I-80 to see firsthand how local leaders are using infrastructure funds to upgrade our roads, highways, and bridges.

I secured provisions in this year’s Senate NDAA to modernize our nuclear triad—essential to helping protect us from growing threats. Joined @northropgrumman CEO Kathy Warden & her team at the Roy Innovation Center to discuss the Sentinel program’s role in our deterrence efforts.

The CCP continues to pose great threats to the supply chains, personnel, and IP of U.S.-based companies. Met with the team at South Jordan-based Strider Technologies to discuss their capabilities for addressing these vulnerabilities & other pressing national security challenges.

Utah-based companies like @TealDrones are playing key roles in our national security and industrial base. Had an engaging discussion on decreasing America’s dependence on China for our hardware supply chains while touring their facility—and even tried my hand at flying a drone.

Although it's facing challenges, China is on a path to dominate the world economically, militarily, and geopolitically. In order to continue leading the world, the U.S. must have a comprehensive, tactical strategy to address the threat China poses to freedom and the global order.

Holladay, like many cities along the Wasatch Front, is a vibrant community that holds a storied history—and I’m proud to call it home! Enjoyed hearing updates from Mayor Dahle and the city council on current and proposed infrastructure projects to support our city's growth.

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure bill, Utah’s communities will be better connected through improved public transportation services. Met with local officials at @RideUTA’s Salt Lake Central Station to discuss projects to improve TRAX, Frontrunner, and bus services.

Utah has been the center of unilateral national monument decisions that are controversial and divisive for nearly 30 years. I will continue to support Utah’s efforts to fight back against this Administration’s gross overreach regarding our lands. sltrib.com/news/politics/202…

My heart goes out to those affected by the wildfire devastation on Maui. Ann and I are grateful for the heroic efforts of the first responders and emergency workers, and praying for the lives lost and all who are suffering. deseret.com/u-s-world/2023/8…

President Biden’s national monument proclamation of 1.1 million acres around the Grand Canyon will be detrimental to ranchers in Southern Utah and negatively impact Utah’s mining industry—which will increase U.S. dependence on Russia and China for uranium.romney.senate.gov/romney-res…

We can’t ignore the reality that social media can negatively impact the lives of our youth. I encourage Utahns to take advantage of this new tool, which provides parents with resources to help their children develop healthy habits online and protect them from potential harm.

The Administration's "Clean Power Plan 2.0" would effectively shut down affordable and reliable energy—intensifying the energy shortage the U.S. is already facing. To avoid an energy supply crisis, @EPA should withdraw this unlawful proposal without delay.romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Our military must be equipped to address the growing threats we face. Proud to have secured several measures in this year’s Senate NDAA to counter China and Russia, reaffirm Utah’s role in our national security, and improve passport services for Utahns. romney.senate.gov/romney-app…

Our partnership with the UK and Australia is critical, especially concerning the strategic landscape in the Indo-Pacific. We must, however, simultaneously protect our national security by making necessary investments in U.S. submarine production capacity.romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Live soon → I’m joining @BoydMatheson on @kslnewsradio to discuss the provisions I secured into the Senate’s annual defense authorization bill that will benefit Utah and strengthen our national security. Tune in:

Part of what makes Utah great are the remarkable young people who already lead and influence their communities for the better. Enjoyed meeting with Utah's delegation to @ALAGirlsNation and @ALBoysNation during their visit to Washington.

A record number of Americans died from a drug overdose last year. My legislation with @Sen_JoeManchin would provide increased access to treatment for those seeking to escape abuse and addiction, supporting Utah's efforts to combat the opioid epidemic.romney.senate.gov/romney-man…

Strategic cooperation with our allies is critical to safeguarding America’s interests abroad. Met with British Ambassador to the United States Karen Pierce on strengthening the US-UK-Australia partnership and its potential to change the strategic landscape in the Indo-Pacific.

Reducing the salt load in the Colorado River helps ensure that Utah meets water quality standards for our communities. Our bipartisan legislation, a long-sought priority for Utah, helps our state shoulder the costs of desalinizing the Colorado River. romney.senate.gov/romney-joi…

Youth leadership programs like @NationalFFA are preparing young people to become influential leaders in their communities. Enjoyed visiting with @UtahFFA state officers to discuss their work representing our state, as well as their post-graduation plans.

Hands-on education opportunities, like those offered at @utahtechu, support Utah’s continued economic growth. Met with Utah Tech President Richard “Biff” Williams to discuss the school's work to support southern Utah's booming economy. This helmet will look great in my office!

A @USCG veteran, former Sheriff for Summit County, and now U.S. Marshal for Utah, Justin Martinez has lived a life dedicated to public service. Enjoyed catching up to hear about the important work he’s doing in his new role in the @USMarshalsHQ.

Taking an internship in Washington provides students with unique opportunities to prepare for meaningful careers in public service and beyond. Enjoyed meeting with a group of @BYU Washington Seminar interns to discuss public service, leadership, and my experience in the Senate.

It's in our interests that Ukraine is successful in defending itself against Putin's Russia, an adversary of the United States. By supporting Ukraine, we help weaken Russia's military—safeguarding our well-being, livelihoods, and the freedom and prosperity we enjoy in America.

Today, Utahns from all backgrounds celebrate our state's storied legacy of determination, faith, and optimism. I'm proud of our pioneer heritage, which continues to show itself in our strong communities, economic vitality, and beehive spirit. Happy Pioneer Day!

To maintain their grip on power, authoritarians like Putin and the CCP censor factual information from their people. Met with @USAGMgov CEO Amanda Bennet to discuss their work to increase access to truthful information from independent sources to those under oppressive regimes.

China is no longer a developing country & shouldn't be treated as such on the global stage. It has the second largest economy in the world & seeks to become the global superpower. Proud my bipartisan NDAA amendment to help end this unfair advantage unanimously passed the Senate.

Our pandemic preparedness bill—which passed out of committee today—includes provisions that cut off funding for research in China, encourage public-private partnerships, give states more flexibility to respond to natural disasters, and improve our health data collection systems.

My colleagues and I have been working on policies that strengthen our response to health emergencies & fill gaps in our public health data. Proud this package passed out of committee with bipartisan support—look forward to it coming before the full Senate.romney.senate.gov/romney-cas…

Great sitting down with @SenatorHick and @GovMikeLeavitt to discuss the need for innovation in education, including the competency-based approach supported by our legislation and demonstrated so well at @wgu.

Drug cartels and China-based fentanyl manufacturers are capitalizing on loopholes under current law to evade sanctions using decentralized finance services. Our bill reinforces our national security by cracking down on crypto-facilitated crimes.romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Wildland firefighters make tremendous sacrifices to save lives, protect property, and safeguard our lands. Proud to have helped advance bipartisan legislation out of committee today to ensure wildland firefighter pay better reflects the crucial work they do for Utah and the West.
To all those celebrating—happy National Hot Dog Day! May there be many more hot dogs served in our wonderful land. 🌭🇺🇸

Competency-based education programs, like those championed at Utah-based @WGU, make learning specific skills for meaningful jobs more accessible. By cementing this learning approach into law, our bill will help prepare more folks for the jobs of the future.romney.senate.gov/romney-hic…

Utah continues to play a key role in our national security. I'm proud to have secured measures in this year's NDAA to benefit our state's efforts—including bills to strengthen the Sentinel program, which has a large presence at @HAFB, and support @USArmyDPG's chem-bio program.

Sending all my best to @GovCox in his new responsibility as chair of the @NatlGovsAssoc! This is a great opportunity for him to promote Utah's values across the country and I look forward to his leadership. Congratulations!

Having to travel long distances out of state to obtain urgent, in-person consular services, Utahns are understandably frustrated. These measures—which have advanced out of @SenateForeign—are an important step to bringing a passport agency to Salt Lake City.romney.senate.gov/foreign-re…

The @Olympics showcase the greatness of the human spirit, and it was one of the greatest honors of my life to organize the 2002 Salt Lake Games. Excited to join @SenAlexPadilla on this legislation to mint commemorative coins for the upcoming 2028 LA Games!romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Both parties must stop with the dishonest claims put forth to score political points and get serious about saving Social Security from its impending collapse. Americans are counting on us to come together to save the program millions of our seniors rely on.deseret.com/2023/7/12/237913…

Taiwan has long been a trusted partner of the United States. Pleased that our bipartisan legislation to help ensure U.S. tax policies reflect our commitment to Taiwan passed out of committee today—I hope to see it go before the full Senate soon. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

In 10 years, Social Security recipients could see an automatic 25% reduction in benefits. We must find a way to save Social Security without adding trillions to the national debt. We have a moral responsibility to act—the clock is ticking. deseret.com/2023/7/12/237913…

It’s irresponsible and reckless to ignore the impending collapse of our federal trust funds. We must put forth serious solutions aimed at saving these programs, like my bipartisan TRUST Act, for the millions of Americans who rely them. deseret.com/2023/7/12/237913…
It’s a long way to the top, but the views are worth it! Great fun taking a couple of my grandkids on a tour of the Capitol Dome while they’re in town. Really brightened up my day!

Importantly, it also includes my measures to help bolster Utah’s role in our defense by ensuring @USArmyDPG can continue to prepare our military for evolving chemical and biological threats and strengthening the Sentinel program—which has a major presence at Utah’s @HAFB.

The Senate NDAA includes my measures to modernize our nuclear triad, help us fully understand China’s defense-industrial complex, bolster our domestic critical mineral capabilities to reduce our dependence on adversaries, and promote military service amid a recruiting crisis.

As the U.S. faces growing threats from adversaries, it's vital that our military has the resources & capabilities it needs to protect our country. Proud that several of my provisions were included in this year’s Senate NDAA to protect against these threats.romney.senate.gov/romney-sec…

COVID-19 showed that monitoring wastewater can provided useful data for detecting and tracking infectious diseases. Our bill will help us be better prepared to fight future pandemics by making investments in new wastewater monitoring technologies. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Even with advances in technology, staying healthy with an autoimmune disease can be immensely challenging. My staff and I met with Utah’s @JDRF Children’s Congress delegates to learn about their experience living with type 1 diabetes and how we can better work toward a cure.

Fish recovery programs help maintain an overall healthy river ecosystem that benefits both people and nature. Our bill supports Utah’s efforts to recover threatened and endangered fish species in the Upper Colorado and San Juan rivers for years to come.romney.senate.gov/romney-hic…

After visiting with members of the Payson Fruit Growers co-op and touring parts of the cherry operation run by the Rowley family, I was very impressed by their innovation and efficiency. This comes as no surprise—congratulations, Phil!

Tonight’s @MLB #AllStarGame will feature a few special guests—four F-35s from Utah’s @HAFB’s @388fw will participate in a flyover above @TMobilePark during the national anthem! Looking forward to this patriotic moment to kick off a hallmark game of American’s favorite pastime.

Congratulations to Utah’s Solicitor General Holyoak on her nomination to this important role at the @FTC. Her commitment to protecting liberty and upholding the Constitution will bode well for the country and I urge my colleagues to swiftly confirm her.

Today, as we celebrate our freedoms with our families, we’re reminded of those who came before us. Their vision and sacrifice laid the foundation for what our country is today: a continued City upon a Hill. Happy Independence Day to all Americans!🇺🇸
Looking forward to the next chapter of our “victr’y story.” Let’s go, @BYUCougars!

During an unprecedented military recruitment crisis, recruiters are facing unfair restrictions and limitations from high school and college administrators. We must ensure students are better exposed to the opportunities and benefits that military service can provide.

The CCP—and its acolytes in the Hong Kong government—continues to repress the freedom loving people of Hong Kong. We condemn the “National Security Law" and its related human rights abuses—including the persecution of those who don’t align with Beijing. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…
My statement on the Supreme Court striking down President Biden’s student debt forgiveness plan:
Biden claims the Court is not “normal.” But normal is following the Constitution, which does not allow discrimination on the basis of race. Preference for one is prejudice for another.

Park City is an important economic driver for our state, hosting millions of visitors each year. This $7.4 million grant will provide visitors with modernized transit services—which is especially critical as Utah contends to host another Winter Olympics. parkrecord.com/news/park-cit…

Broadband access is critical for education and the economic development of communities throughout Utah. Proud to have helped secure needed resources—including this $317 million award to expand internet in our state—in the bipartisan infrastructure bill.romney.senate.gov/romney-wel…

Look up today, Utah! To celebrate 100 years of air refueling, a critical defense capability, the @usairforce and @UtahAirGuard have scheduled flyovers across the state today. 🇺🇸 Check out the schedule here: kpcw.org/park-city/2023-06-2…

Our military's current recruiting crisis significantly impacts our national security. Amid the threats we face, we must bolster our long-term military readiness—which is why I've introduced legislation to enhance military recruiter access to high schools and colleges.

It's critical that we boost our domestic production of copper—a material key to our industrial base—in order to shrink our reliance on China. @RioTinto's investment in the @KennecottUtah copper mine will strengthen our supply, and in turn, our defense and economic stability.

Utah's lands are best managed by the people closest to them, not federal bureaucrats. I applaud @RepJohnCurtis for standing up against @BLMNational's overreaching land management proposal, which is detrimental to the Utahns who rely on these lands for economic development.

An antiquated perimeter rule put on @Reagan_Airport is making travel to our nation's capital less affordable and accessible for Utahns. Proud to join my Utah colleagues on this bill to reduce barriers for all Americans to visit the home of democracy.romney.senate.gov/utah-congr…

We put our national security and economic vitality at risk by relying on countries like China for critical minerals. Our legislation will bolster our domestic critical minerals capabilities and reduce our dependence on China, Russia, and other adversaries.romney.senate.gov/romney-sul…
Today, we commemorate a monumental milestone in our nation’s history—the end of slavery. As we celebrate, we also affirm our commitment to pursue a more perfect Union. Happy #Juneteenth! 🇺🇸

I was proud to have secured funding to expand rural broadband in the bipartisan infrastructure bill. This latest funding announcement is great news for Washington and Iron counties—bringing affordable, high-speed internet to Utah’s underserved communities. usda.gov/media/press-release…

Our partnership with Kenya is important for our overall security and economic interests. Met with my friend @USAmbKenya Meg Whitman for an update on her work as Ambassador and the U.S.– Kenya relationship, including engagements regarding trade and security.

My office has seen a massive increase in passport related inquiries and emergency request from Utahns. These passport processing delays have become unacceptable, and the State Department needs to take immediate action to address them. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Our reliance on China for critical minerals creates serious vulnerabilities for our national security. Proud our legislation aimed at strengthening our supply chains and bolstering production of critical minerals here at home passed out of committee.romney.senate.gov/romney-pet…

As China and Russia continue to strengthen their nuclear forces, it’s essential that we rapidly modernize our nuclear triad. Our bill would bolster the Sentinel program, which has a major presence at @HAFB and is vital to our nuclear deterrence efforts.romney.senate.gov/romney-fis…

Utah was well-represented at the National History Day contest in D.C. this week! Great meeting with so many students from across our state to talk about their trip and a few of the defining moments in American history.

Salt Lake Community College supports thousands of Utahns in preparing for meaningful careers. Sat down with @SaltLakeCC President Deneece Huftalin for a discussion on policies to better support Utah's higher education, including the College Transparency Act and my GRAD Act.

Studying history helps prepare young people to shape the future for the better. Enjoyed meeting with four exceptional students from Dixie High School to congratulate them on their strong performance at the state level of the National History Day competition.
Happy 248th birthday, @USArmy! Thank you to the soldiers who protect our country and secure our freedoms and values.

The United States’ standing with nations around the world stems in part to us having been the global superpower. As alternatives like China arise, making key investments in our relationships with other countries is critical to securing our interests at home and abroad.

China has carried out a strategy seeking to own the supply chains of critical minerals essential for the technologies of today and tomorrow. To counter our reliance on China, we must ensure our foreign policies and investment programs consider how to better compete in this space.

TRIO pre-college programs provide opportunities for students to find success in high school and be well-prepared for higher education. Enjoyed meeting with these high school students from Utah during their National Student Leadership Congress trip to Washington, D.C.

Utah is rapidly growing and we need sufficient transportation infrastructure to maintain our economic vitality. Sat down with @CarlosUDOT to go over our state’s plans for further infrastructure development aimed at alleviating congestion in high growth areas.

The United States’ reliance on China for critical minerals creates serious vulnerabilities for our national security. Our legislation will help identify how we can strengthen supply chains and bolster production of critical minerals here at home.romney.senate.gov/romney-pet…
My statement on reports of the indictment of former President Trump:romney.senate.gov/romney-sta…

Each year, more than two million people visit Bryce Canyon to see its awe-inspiring views and participate in its wide range of recreational opportunities. Utahns are blessed to have this national treasure in our backyard. Happy Centennial, @BryceCanyonNPS!
fox13now.com/news/local-news…

All people deserve to feel safe from sexual and domestic violence in their homes and communities. Thank you to the representatives from @UCASAorg and @UtahDv for meeting with me to discuss ways to better support victims of rape, sexual assault, and domestic violence.

The threat social media has on the well-being of our young people and our national security is becoming more and more evident. By increasing data access and transparency, our bill will help the public better understand social media's impact on society.romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

It's absurd that China, which has the world's second largest economy, is treated as a developing nation on the global stage. Proud our bipartisan bill ending China’s unfair advantage passed out of committee—look forward to it coming to the Senate floor. romney.senate.gov/romney-van…

The Commission I helped secure into the bipartisan infrastructure law is developing solutions to help communities prevent, manage, and recover from wildfires. I'm encouraged by their findings so far—we must meet our modern challenges with modern solutions.romney.senate.gov/romney-wel…

The wildfires in Canada—and the resulting air quality problems we're experiencing across the U.S.—are a reminder of the increased urgency we have to modernize our fire management policies. Continuing to do things the way we’ve done them in the past won’t meet our current needs.

Proud that the Senate confirmed Justin Martinez to be U.S. Marshal for the District of Utah. A @USCG veteran and @SummitCountyUT Sheriff, Justin has dedicated his life to keeping our communities safe. Congratulations, Justin!

Utah's continued housing shortage is making it difficult for many Utahns to secure reasonable accommodations. Met with members of the Utah Home Builders Association for a discussion on improving access to affordable housing and addressing labor shortages in construction.

Our military is facing the largest recruitment crisis in 50 years, which greatly impacts our national security. Military recruiters must be given equal access to schools to educate students about the opportunities and benefits military service can provide.romney.senate.gov/romney-kin…

Passport demand in Utah is enormous, due in part to our robust global commerce & the thousands of missionaries leaving from SLC every year. Yet our state is a passport service desert with no feasible options for in-person services. @StateDept must open a passport agency in Utah.

79 years since the D-Day landing on Omaha beach, today we remember and honor the monumental bravery of our allied armed forces. These men represented the best of the American spirit—an unmatched resolve to protect freedom at home and abroad. We will never forget their sacrifice.

34 years ago, pro-democracy protestors were horrifically murdered by the CCP at Tiananmen Square. China's pursuit of human rights abuses continues today—including the Uyghur genocide. We must continue to condemn China’s hostility and affirm our commitment to defending freedom.

We can't for one second trust CCP pronouncements regarding its defense spending—or allow this misleading information to influence U.S. policymaking. It’s critical for our national security that we accurately understand China's military investments.romney.senate.gov/romney-man…

The Biden Administration's student loan schemes are fiscally irresponsible and morally questionable. Hardworking taxpayers shouldn’t be forced to foot the bill for someone else's debt. Joined my colleagues in voting to overturn the Administration's unfair and misguided policies.

The global competition between dictatorship and democracy is center stage in Ukraine. The world is watching to see whether we have the courage of our convictions to honor our long-standing commitment to Ukraine’s sovereignty. America will not shrink from our support of freedom.

I didn't come to Washington just to "fight" and lose. I came to fight and win, which is why I've worked with my colleagues in good faith—on both sides of the aisle—to craft and pass meaningful bills that have an actual impact on the lives of Utahns and the American people.

Putin’s Russia is not our friend and it is China’s most powerful ally. Supporting Ukraine weakens an adversary, enhances our national security advantage, and requires no shedding of American blood. deseret.com/opinion/2023/3/4…

Doing the right thing for another nation can also be the right thing for America. It is in our interest to support Ukraine. Doing so makes Russia far less likely to launch major new wars, which would further damage our economy and threaten our security. deseret.com/opinion/2023/3/4…

China has designed an encompassing, long-term strategy to replace the U.S. as the global leader economically, militarily, and geopolitically. We must be clear-eyed on China's ambitions and develop our own comprehensive China strategy.

Treating our water resources responsibly is critical to maintaining Utah's quality of life. This project, funded by our bipartisan infrastructure bill, supports endangered fish and helps ensure our communities have access to safe and reliable water sources.romney.senate.gov/romney-app…

The Civil Air Patrol carries an important mission of serving our communities, saving lives, and preparing young people for the future. Enjoyed meeting with members of the @UtahWingCAP, including two cadets, and thanking them for their commitment to serve Utah.

Our tax policies should reflect our commitment to a strong relationship with Taiwan, which has long been a trusted partner of the United States. Proud to join my colleagues on this effort to strengthen economic ties between our two countries. romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

Nuclear energy is non-emitting, available now, and can be used alongside traditional sources as we continue to invest in clean energy technology. Met with @SmartEnergy1 members for a discussion on the future of energy in Utah.

We must be prepared for a wide range of security threats, reduce our national debt, and improve oversight of how taxpayer dollars are spent. I look forward to tackling these issues as Ranking Member of the Homeland Security Emerging Threats subcommittee.romney.senate.gov/romney-to-…

College students from Utah are among our nation’s brightest and have a strong desire to do good in the world. Enjoyed sitting down with a group of @USUAggies to talk about their experience interning in Washington, D.C.

China’s quest to become the world’s leading power is the central challenge we face in the 21st Century. As Ranking Member of the Foreign Relations China & Cybersecurity subcommittee, I will continue working to address the new era of competition with China.romney.senate.gov/romney-to-…

I was proud to negotiate the bipartisan infrastructure bill, which continues to benefit Utah as more resources—including the funding from these latest announcements—get allocated to support critical water and transportation projects across our state. romney.senate.gov/utah-conti…

Credit unions are an integral part of Utah's strong and growing economy. Enjoyed speaking with members and leaders of @UtahsCUs on the latest in Washington and ways to support the financial service needs of Utahns.

College students today face new and unique challenges, including a rise in mental health problems. Met with @BYU Strategic Relations Manager Julie Hatchett and Student Body President Ethan Baker on bolstering student resources and the University's future in the @Big12Conference.

Reliable and accessible energy resources are critical to powering Utah's economy and meeting the needs of our communities. Met with mayors who represent the Utah Municipal Power Agency to discuss how we can ensure reliable services and competitive rates for our cities and towns.

Following the 2002 Salt Lake City Olympic Games, Utah has led the country and the world as the hub of winter sports. Met with @USOPC_CEO Sarah Hirshland and Chairman Gene Sykes to discuss efforts to get the Winter Games back to Salt Lake City in the coming decade.
It will require a team effort—state, local, and federal governments, along with the people of Utah—but together, we can save the Great Salt Lake.

We can't allow the Great Salt Lake to dry up. If the lakebed is exposed—winds will spread harmful dusts across the Wasatch Front, posing alarming health and environmental risks to our communities. With proper organization and public support, I'm confident we can save the Lake.

If we don’t take aggressive action now to save the Great Salt Lake, the consequences for our air quality, ecosystems, and way of life will be severe. With public support, and the collaborative efforts of state, local, and federal entities, we can save the Great Salt Lake.

Clyde Companies has been an integral part of Utah's growth as they’ve supported our communities' building and construction needs. Met with @ClydeCompanies managers and employees for a discussion on business, upcoming infrastructure projects, and climate technologies.
One year since the start of Russia’s war, Ukraine proudly stands a sovereign nation. We continue to stand with the people of Ukraine.

As leader of the free world, the United States must be clear-eyed on the malign ambitions and capabilities of adversaries like China and Russia. Spoke with members of the @UADAssociation on our role in addressing the global threats to freedom we face in the 21st century.

The Purple Heart recognizes the immeasurable sacrifice made by servicemembers like Utah's @USMC Corporal Bryan Hood, who sustained injuries from an IED blast while deployed in Afghanistan. It was a solemn honor to participate in his Purple Heart ceremony at our state Capitol.

Our state and local leaders work hard to continue Utah’s legacy as one of the best-managed states in the country. Enjoyed spending the afternoon meeting with both parties in the Utah House and Senate to report on our efforts to support the unique needs of our state in Washington.

Live soon→ I'm joining @BoydMatheson on @kslnewsradio for a discussion on the outlook for the 118th Congress—including efforts to address the growing China threat, our burgeoning national debt, and managing Utah's drought and wildfires. Tune in: tuner.bonneville.com/?KSL-AM

The Wildland Fire Mitigation and Management Commission is working to help us improve our wildfire strategies. Met with Commission members, including Utah’s Kathy Holder and Bill Cox, to discuss their report on employing aviation resources to better equip wildland firefighters.

After 30 years, @NBAAllStar is returning to Salt Lake City this weekend! To our visitors—enjoy Utah's unparalleled recreation opportunities, unique cultural experiences, and thriving capital city. Amid the excitement, I encourage folks to stay safe and plan for heavy crowds.

We spend nearly double that of the average developed nation on health care, yet we're unable to provide quality care at reasonable costs. The answer isn't to spend more, but to consider solutions—in line with successful private sector industries—to address our health care woes.

Current reporting requirements fall short in reflecting the unique make-up of students at schools like @SnowCollege and @SaltLakeCC. Our bill would ensure the government more accurately measures success at community colleges in Utah and across the country.romney.senate.gov/romney-hic…

We are facing a desperate shortage of health care professionals, yet the State Department is too concerned with COVID to conduct the interviews required to bring more nurses into the U.S. The Administration needs to get to work and do what's needed to staff our care facilities.

It’s outrageous—and even immoral—to keep ignoring our burgeoning national debt, leaving our children and grandchildren saddled with the consequences. We have an obligation to future generations to get our spending under control now.

Today's announcement was made possible by the passage of our China competition bill, which I was proud to support. We must continue to promote innovation, foster scientific talent, and expand U.S. research if we are going to compete with China. romney.senate.gov/romney-app…

.@TXInstruments' decision to build a new semiconductor facility in Lehi proves that Utah continues to be a great place for business. This historic $11 billion investment will strengthen our country's manufacturing capabilities & help break U.S. dependence on China for microchips.

Democrats’ climate proposals are wildly expensive and might make us feel good, but they have little impact on actually lowering global emissions. If we're serious about reducing emissions, we must focus our investments on technology and innovation that can have a global impact.

The next generation of Utah’s farmers and ranchers face unique challenges as a result of the drought, inflation, and labor shortages. Met with young @UtahFarmBureau members to discuss ideas on how we can better equip our producers to continue providing for our nation's families.

Utah is known for its strong and connected communities, thanks in part to organizations like the @ymca. Met with YMCA of Northern Utah CEO Rich West and two youth participants to discuss their latest efforts to strengthen our neighborhoods and enrich the lives our young people.

Our wildland fire commission has brought together top experts to help improve our wildfire strategies. Grateful for their work in identifying ways we can employ aviation resources to better equip wildland firefighters who are on the frontlines.romney.senate.gov/romney-wel…

Federal overreach has long posed challenges for Utah, which is why I push for more local input on federal actions that affect our state. Met with elected officials from counties across Utah for a discussion on effectively advancing our state’s priorities here in Washington.

I was proud to negotiate the bipartisan infrastructure bill, which continues to deliver for Utah. Because of this legislation, our state will receive much needed funding to improve access to safe and clean water in our rural and disadvantaged communities. epa.gov/newsreleases/biden-h…

Today in 1870, Seraph Young became the first woman to vote in the U.S. under a women's equal suffrage law—50 years before the 19th Amendment was ratified. On #FirstToVote Day, we recognize the trailblazing women like Seraph who have played a vital role in our state's history.

We must fashion—with the help of outside minds—a comprehensive series of strategic and tactical options on how to deal with the rising threat posed by the CCP. Not doing so will leave us in a weaker position at a time when we must be fighting to preserve our freedom & prosperity.

It’s essential that we strengthen our water and wastewater infrastructure as we seek to mitigate the effects of Utah's drought. Enjoyed meeting with the @UtahRuralWater Association to discuss their work to provide sustainable and reliable water systems to our rural communities.

Principles alone are not enough to address the growing threat posed by the Chinese Communist Party. The Biden Administration must—by law—move from ad hoc principles to a comprehensive strategy that guides our approach to dealing with China.

It’s absurd that China is treated as a developing nation on the global stage when it has the second largest economy in the world and is on track to surpass the U.S. economically. We shouldn’t enter into treaties or organizations under such false pretenses.romney.senate.gov/romney-van…

We can't afford for China to be the global leader in producing resources critical to our national security. Met with @RioTinto CEO Jakob Stausholm to discuss @KennecottUtah and efforts to get copper designated as a critical mineral, which would bolster our domestic supply chain.
My thoughts on the President's State of the Union address:

Under the leadership of Maj. Gen. Turley—Adjutant General of the @UTNationalGuard—our outstanding airmen and soldiers have answered the call of duty to protect Utahns and Americans in times of emergency. I’m honored to have him as my guest to tonight’s State of the Union address.

I'm deeply saddened by the devastating loss of life as a result of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria. As we monitor the latest news, Ann and I offer our prayers for the victims' families and loved ones, as well as the emergency teams seeking to rescue survivors.

Rs and Ds both recognize the fact that Social Security and Medicare are heading for insolvency. Without action, retirees will see drastic benefit cuts. If you’re against a *process* to even talk about possible solutions, you’re not serious about saving these programs.

During bipartisan infrastructure bill negotiations, I was proud to finally get funding for the Navajo Utah Water Settlement across the finish line. Glad @Interior is continuing to fulfill the funding of the Settlement, which is bringing running water to Navajo Nation in Utah.
A big Chinese balloon in the sky and millions of Chinese TikTok balloons on our phones. Let’s shut them all down.

China's recent charm offensive is a Potemkin village, attempting to conceal their malign ambitions toward our country and the global order. We must be clear-eyed on China and appropriately respond to this provocation—including securing our airspace and affirming our sovereignty.

Relying on adversarial countries like China for copper puts our national security at risk. The Administration should swiftly designate copper as a critical mineral to better ensure a reliable supply of domestic copper resources—including those mined at @RioTinto’s @KennecottUtah.

Global companies, like Swiss-based Stadler Rail, are setting up their U.S. operations in Utah thanks to our state's pro-business policies & prosperous outlook. Enjoyed meeting with Stadler U.S. CEO Martin Ritter to discuss the company’s role in supporting Utah’s growing economy.

The Biden Administration's WOTUS rule is a blatant federal power grab of our nation's waters—imposing harmful and burdensome regulations on Utah’s farmers, ranchers, and landowners. Proud to join my colleagues in opposing it.romney.senate.gov/romney-col…

There's no doubt we are facing a crisis at our southern border. At the same time, Utah job creators are facing labor shortages and are in desperate need of workers. We must secure the border and stop the flood of illegal immigration, while also updating the legal visa process.

Young people in Utah know it's never too early to get involved in public service. Enjoyed meeting with youth coalitions from across our state to learn about their efforts to help strengthen the health and wellbeing of their communities.

We must find ways to balance the budget and rein in excessive spending. Congress must return to an appropriations process where individual aspects of federal spending are examined instead of lumping everything together into a massive funding bill at the last minute.

The Biden Administration’s recent ESG rule would further harm Americans' retirement funds by forcing fiduciaries to advance social causes rather than investing to get the best return. They should not play political games with Americans' hard-earned money. romney.senate.gov/romney-joi…

Thanks to funding provided by our bipartisan infrastructure bill, communities across Utah—including Cache Valley, Cedar City, Green River, and those in southern Utah and along the Wasatch Front—will receive grants to prevent deaths and serious injuries on our state’s roadways.

Meaningful legislation requires bipartisanship to become law, which is why I've worked with colleagues on both sides of the aisle to get things done. I didn’t come to Washington just to “fight” and lose, I came to win and deliver results for Utah and our country.

If the Great Salt Lake runs dry, exposed dusts and metals at the lakebed could seriously harm our health and wellbeing. Real action—collaborative efforts among local, state, and federal entities—is essential to saving the Lake, which has hit historic lows in the past year.

Congress only votes on one-third of our federal spending—two-thirds of this spending goes to our entitlement programs and happens automatically. Programs like Social Security are on the brink of insolvency and Congress must work to rescue these programs before they collapse.

As we begin working in the new Congress, I remain committed to the legislative objectives that I believe are most critical, including balancing the budget and reining in spending; fixing our broken immigration system; and helping Utah mitigate the effects of historic drought.

Utahns continue to do their part to conserve water and respect the needs of our neighbors who share the Colorado River as a significant source of supply. While the challenge remains to find an agreement among all seven states, I’m glad to see consensus-based progress being made.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we honor the 11 million victims—including 6 million Jews—who were senselessly and brutally murdered during the Holocaust. As #WeRemember those lost, may we also affirm our commitment to fight against anti-Semitism and bigotry in all its forms.

History has taught us that when one country feels they can invade another country with little consequence, violence spreads and we become vulnerable to being pulled into a conflict. Supporting Ukraine is not just the right thing to do, it’s imperative for U.S. national security.

I helped craft the bipartisan infrastructure bill so this Administration wouldn't look past the needs of our growing state. Met with elected officials from @WasatchCouncil and @Utah_mag to discuss their collaborative efforts on new infrastructure projects to best support Utahns.

Religious freedom continues to be suppressed by authoritarian regimes around the world, including the CCP. Met with @IRF_Ambassador to discuss developments related to religious freedom, persecution, and discrimination and how we can better protect it at home and abroad.

It’s imperative that we improve strategies to prevent wildfires from becoming catastrophic disasters, which is why I fought to ensure funding for projects that strengthen Utah’s wildfire resilience was included in the bipartisan infrastructure bill. romney.senate.gov/romney-wel…

All human life, including the life of unborn children, is sacred. In solidarity with all those who #MarchForLife today, I affirm my commitment to defending the dignity of life and supporting policies that protect society’s most vulnerable.

As the Utah Legislature begins its 2023 General Session, I send my best wishes to @BradWilsonGOP, @JStuartAdams, and the @UtahHouseReps & @UtahSenate legislators. May the tradition of bipartisanship continue so Utah remains one the best-managed states in the country! #utpol

Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. spoke: “Everybody can be great because anybody can serve. ... You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love." On #MLKDay, let us be united in advancing the dream he had for our country through service and commitment to freedom.

Law enforcement officers play an irreplaceable role in keeping our communities and institutions safe. On #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay, we express our gratitude to those who wear the badge and recognize their commitment to service.
127 years later, still as beautiful as ever. Happy Statehood Day, Utah!

This past year, I focused my efforts in Washington on helping tackle Utah’s drought and water issues, countering the China threat, supporting Ukraine, pushing for fiscal responsibility, and promoting key Utah priorities. My 2022 Policy Highlights report: romney.senate.gov/romney-hig…
